fr.upmc.components.ports

Interface DataOutboundPortI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ComponentImplementedI, DataRequiredI.PullI, DataRequiredI.PushI, OfferedI, OutboundPortI, PortI, java.rmi.Remote, RequiredI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDataOutboundPort, RNGDataOutboundPort, SensorDataOutboundPort, SensorSimulator.BridgeDataOutboundPort

    public interface DataOutboundPortI
extends OutboundPortI, DataRequiredI.PullI, DataRequiredI.PushI
    The interface DataOutboundPortI represents the category of ports used by components exchanging data rather than calling providers for their services.

    Description

    An outbound port is associated with a BasicDataRequiredI interface used to implement a basic interface to get data from a provider component. The primary way to get the data is the pull mode, where the client component calls the provider through the request() method which returns a piece of data. But the port can also be used in a push mode where the provider delivers the data to the client by calling a receive method with a piece of data as parameter.

    Created on : 2011-11-07

    Version:
    $Name$ -- $Revision$ -- $Date$
    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
